task_study.Description: Participants viewed words and provided Yes/No responses to either a shoebox or manmade judgments. Participants received either an informative cue (red or blue square) or uninformative/uncued cue (fixation cross remained) about the judgment to make. Note, uninformative trials/files/instructions/descriptions should be conceptually considered to be uncued/no cue trials.

study_cb.Description: Stimulus file counterbalance with levels of A(informative; ABBA) and B (Uninformative/uncued;BAAB).

phase_name.Description: Block type and study list: Informed(1 or 2)_study(1-4) or Uninformed(1-2)_study(1-4)

study_phase.Description: Block type: Informed1, Informed2, Uninformed1, Uninformed2

manmade.Description: Manmade judgment correct response: Y or N

shoebox.Description: Shoebox judgment correct response: Y or N

old_new.Description: Word is old or new for subsequent recognition task

study_judgment.Description: Study judgment trial type: shoebox or manmade

cue_condition.Description: Study cue condition: Informative or Uninformative trial

cue_color.Description: Color of cue: cyan (manmade), red (shoebox), and n/a for uninformed trials

box_color.Description: Color of box around the word: white, cyan, red

show_cue.Description: Indicates if a cue was shown for this trial: 1 (yes), 0 (no)

study_resp_key.Description: Participants judgment response: j (yes) or k (no), and na for no responses

study_resp.Description: Participants numeric judgment response: 1 (yes:j) or 2 (no:k), and -99 for no responses

study_rt.Description: Participants judgment reaction time, and -99 for no responses

study_good_trial.Description: Numerically mark if trial is good (1) or bad (0) based on if participants made a judgment response, see preregistration for more information
